thread.title: Dublin weather: Met Eireann warns of 'isolated thunderstorms' and sleet in nasty weekend forecast
thread.title_full: Dublin weather: Met Eireann warns of 'isolated thunderstorms' and sleet in nasty weekend forecast - Dublin Live

author: Kim O'Leary
title: Dublin weather: Met Eireann warns of 'isolated thunderstorms' and sleet in nasty weekend forecast
text: Met Eireann has warned of further thunderstorms for Dublin this weekend in a miserable forecast, with a risk of sleet on higher ground overnight. Storm Gerrit has passed over the country, but [stormy conditions](https://www.dublinlive.ie/all-about/met-eireann) are expected to continue for the weekend heading into the New Year. Met Eireann has said today will be windy with sunny spells and heavy showers. There's also a risk [thunderstorms](https://www.dublinlive.ie/all-about/met-eireann) and lightning strikes for some areas, with highest temperatures of 6 to 8 degrees. Tonight will be cold with rain at first followed by strong winds, and [Met Eireann ](https://www.dublinlive.ie/all-about/met-eireann)says there is a chance of transient falls of sleet on the leading edge of the rain. Read more: [Dublin weather: Met Eireann warns of thunderstorms as cold temperatures with 'added wind chill factor'](https://www.dublinlive.ie/news/dublin-news/dublin-weather-met-eireann-warns-28356572) Read more: [Ireland weather latest and when gusts will be strongest in Dublin as further Storm Gerrit warnings issued](https://www.dublinlive.ie/news/dublin-news/ireland-weather-latest-gusts-strongest-28355753) Lowest temperatures will range from 1 to 3 degrees overnight. In the west of the country, a Status Yellow rain warning will come into effect today and Saturday for North Mayo, Sligo, Leitrim and Donegal on Saturday. Independent weather expert Alan O'Reilly from Carlow Weather has said 30mm of rainfall is possible over a 24-hour period in these counties in line with the Status Yellow warning. He wrote on X today: "A cooler fresh morning with some clear spells but also some heavy showers in West and North." While [Met Eireann](https://www.dublinlive.ie/all-about/met-eireann) has no further forecast for [Dublin](https://www.dublinlive.ie/all-about/dublin), according to the national outlook, the rest of the week will be "rather cold and unsettled". Here's the rest of the [weather](https://www.dublinlive.ie/all-about/weather) forecast: Saturday A wet and windy start to the day with rain, heavy or thundery at times with some localised flooding possible. The rain will clear to sunny spells and showers through the afternoon. Some showers will be heavy with a chance of isolated thunderstorms and hail. Highest afternoon temperatures of 8 or 9 degrees in fresh to strong and gusty southerly winds. Saturday night Clear spells and squally showers overnight, most frequent in the west and southwest. Lowest temperatures of 3 to 6 degrees in fresh to strong and gusty southerly or cyclonic variable winds. Sunday Breezy or windy with sunny spells and scattered showers and a chance of hail. Fresh to strong and gusty westerly or cyclonic variable winds will gradually decrease moderate to fresh and gusty through the day. Highest temperatures of 5 to 8 degrees generally. Sunday night Showers will continue overnight, mainly for Atlantic counties with longer spells of rain possible in the northwest. Some frost or ice will form with lowest temperatures of -1 to +3 degrees in mostly moderate westerly winds. New Year's Day (Monday) Sunny spells and scattered showers at first, becoming more isolated through the morning and early afternoon. Cloud will build from the southwest with rain following, extending northeastwards over much of the country by night-time. Highest afternoon temperatures of 5 to 8 degrees in light to moderate southwesterly winds, backing southeasterly and increasing moderate to fresh with the rain.
